s.text: Bringing AOL into it just adds more juice to the world's first-ever Internet libel case.
Bringing AOL into it just adds more juice to the world's first-ever Internet libel case.
Bringing AOL into it just adds more juice to the world's first-ever Internet libel case.
Bringing AOL into it just adds more juice to the world's first-ever Internet libel case.
Bringing AOL into it just adds more juice to the world's first-ever Internet libel case.
The WP reports that White House aide Sidney Blumenthal and his wife filed suit yesterday against Matt Drudge and AOL, asking $10 million in compensatory damages and $20 million in punitive damages.
